intro: Guizotia, commonly known as the "pumpkinseed" or "buttercup bush," is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its yellow or orange flowers, which resemble those of the sunflower family. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Its seeds are often used in traditional medicine and as a source of oil. Guizotia species are also valued for their ornamental appeal and ecological benefits.
